item.title: Once Human Releases Its Second Update for April 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Once Human received a new update on April 12.
  • While the lack of version number changes clearly labels this patch as a minor release, the update still introduces a decent number of changes in the form of nearly a dozen bug fixes, performance improvements, and exploit plugs.
  • The pace of Once Human updates has been ramping up as of late, perhaps due to the game's much-anticipated mobile port, which is scheduled to arrive on April 23.

A new Once Human update rolled out on April 12. The patch eliminates nearly a dozen known issues in Once Human , polishing the game just ahead of its wider release.

The debut title from NetEase subsidiary Starry Studio originally hit the market in early July 2024. Although Once Human is still only available on PC nine months later, this prolonged timed exclusivity period is now finally coming to an end, with the hit free-to-play game being scheduled to reach Android and iOS devices on April 23.

Ahead of Once Human 's mobile debut, the popular open-world survival game received yet another update, which rolled out on Saturday, April 12. The changelog attached to the new patch numbers 11 items, most of which are bug fixes. One of them eliminates a task progress blocker that sometimes materialized after surviving a Securement Silo on the Nightmare difficulty, while another resolves an oversight that has so far consistently spammed players with error messages whenever they opened report descriptions.

Once Human Updates Are Ramping Up

The April 12 patch marks the second Once Human update in just five days, which is a rapid pace even by Starry Studio's standards. That said, both of the developer's two latest updates were minor releases, as underlined by the fact that neither of them bumped the game's version number, which has been unchanged since the 1.4.4 update reached Once Human in late March 2025.

In addition to bug fixes, the mid-April patch irons out some performance problems, including a previously reported issue with the Aero Leap item causing stuttering whenever the player is sprinting or rolling. Starry Studio has also managed to deal with an in-game store bug that prevented the weekly purchase limit for the Once Human Scenario Exit Card from resetting. Moreover, the update eliminates an exploit allowing Securement Silo - SIGMA to be skipped while procuring its rewards.

The new patch is likely to please anyone playing Once Human with a controller, on account of fixing an annoying bug that made the Talk option non-interactive whenever the game detected a gamepad. Shadow Gatling respawn blockers have also been addressed with this update, together with an issue that sometimes made the World Map act erratically, jumping to a fog-of-war area after being opened. Based on Starry Studio's recent activity, it's possible that Once Human will receive even more hotfixes ahead of its upcoming mobile debut.

Once Human Update 1.4.4. Patch Notes

Dear Metas,

Since the official release of Once Human version 1.4.4, we have been gathering community feedback and actively addressing your concerns. Here are the latest fixes we have implemented:

  1. Fixed an issue preventing task progress from advancing after completing a Securement Silo on Nightmare difficulty.
  2. Fixed an issue where using the Aero Leap item led to stuttering while rolling and sprinting.
  3. Fixed an issue where the weekly purchase limit for the Scenario Exit Card did not reset.
  4. Fixed an issue that caused errors while entering report descriptions.
  5. Fixed an issue where the Talk option could not be selected when using a controller.
  6. Fixed an issue where Securement Silo - SIGMA could be skipped, yielding the rewards from its item hunt game mode.
  7. Fixed an issue where Shadow Gatling in Securement Silo - SIGMA did not respawn.
  8. Fixed an issue where blueprint fragments would be lost or have incorrect acquisition quantities.
  9. Fixed an issue where the World Map would jump to a misted area when opened.
  10. Fixed an issue where Deviations had incorrect linked statuses after being withdrawn from the Account Depot.
  11. Fixed an issue where The Way of Winter's Scenario Challenge namecard and theme failed to unlock when claimed. Affected players will receive the rewards via in-game mail this week.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 1 Shouldnâ€™t Be the End All Be All For Dracula
item.description:
Narrative is a tricky thing to get right in an ongoing live-service game. If there are too many evolving story beats, it runs the risk of players losing the plot if they return from a brief absence. But if there's too little story, then players might feel the game lacks enough narrative context to keep the in-game action relevant and exciting. So far, Marvel Rivals has struck a pretty good balance.

Season 1 of Marvel Rivals saw Dracula leading his army of vampires into New York City. Over the course of the season, players were given frequent lore entries that revealed a bit more about the origins of Dracula's conquest and his relationships with fellow Marvel characters like Blade. This approach gave those invested in the ongoing story plenty to sink their teeth into, while not getting in the way of those who prefer to jump into the action right away. Marvel Rivals Season 2 seems to be leaving Dracula behind, but this appearance shouldn't be the last fans see of the Transylvanian vampire lord.

Marvel Rivals Season 1 Shouldn't Be The End For Dracula

Dracula's Invasion of New York Was a Great Backdrop for Season 1

Marvel Rivals ' main plot revolves around the ongoing Timestream Entanglement that Doctor Doom and his 2099 counterpart created as a result of their experiments with time energy. This Timestream Entanglement has forced multiple universes and timelines to converge, and while various Marvel heroes are trying to find a way to return to the status quo, Marvel's villains are doing what they do best, using the chaos to further their own gains.

Dracula is one such villain. Using the mysterious Chronovium energy gifted by Doctor Doom, Dracula invaded New York at the start of Marvel Rivals Season 1, and his season has set a high bar for the hero shooter's future. Though Dracula rarely appeared in the game itself, his invasion of New York acted as the perfect narrative backdrop, paving the way for some very unique, well-themed maps, some thrilling cameos, and some potential teases for future playable characters.

Based on the Marvel Rivals Season 2: Hellfire Gala reveal trailer, it seems as though beloved Marvel villain Ultron will be playing the antagonist role next, with the AI adversary invading Mutantkind's living island of Krakoa. Unfortunately, that might mean Dracula's time in Marvel Rivals has come to an end.

Though there are still a few days left of Marvel Rivals Season 1 at the time of writing, it seems very likely Dracula will be left behind, with the most recent lore entries stating that Doom has switched sides so that he can take the Pure Blood Chronovium from Dracula once he's been defeated.

Dracula Deserves The Same Future as Ultron

Despite seemingly being the main antagonist of Marvel Rivals Season 2, it's already been confirmed that Ultron will be a playable character. In fact, Ultron will be Season 2's mid-season roster addition, which means he'll presumably turn heel in just a month's time. Regardless of how that heel-turn will be written into Marvel Rivals ' ongoing story, it'll be great to see such a popular Marvel villain get the chance to stick around for the long term.

It would be great if Dracula could be given the same treatment. Though developer NetEase reportedly has a lot of playable characters already waiting in the wings, it would be neat if it got back around to Dracula at some point during Marvel Rivals ' future, perhaps on the anniversary of the game's first season next year, though that might be thinking too far in the future.

item.title: War Robots Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
War Robots is a dynamic multiplayer shooter where you and other players will play as robots with different guns and skills. The higher your level, the more components, resources, and robots you will have.

To quickly level up and advance in the game, we recommend redeeming War Robots codes. The rewards from the codes will be many useful things, such as various boosters that will increase your efficiency.

Updated April 12, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Thereâ€™s one working code in War Robots that gives you a mix of Defense, Resource, and Attack Boosters. Itâ€™s a solid bonus if youâ€™re looking to gear up quickly. More codes might be added later, so itâ€™s worth checking back.

All War Robots Codes

Working War Robots Codes

  • WARROBOTS10 - Redeem this code to get ten Defense Boosters, ten Resource Boosters, and ten Attack Boosters.

Expired War Robots Codes

  • GCACDDFECBAA
  • ABCDEFGA
  • wrnewyear2025
  • GC-SGHQ-SEFLKI
  • GC-SREA-NBCAAO
  • warrobots999
  • WRFIRSTCODE01
  • GC-TOQZ-SKABBD
  • GC-SUDI-AMHVDJ
  • GC-HPKJ-ROOVBS

Regardless of your progress in the game, redeeming War Robots codes will always be a nice bonus. With the rewards you receive, you can level up much faster and unlock more features and robots, so be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes for War Robots

Redeeming War Robots codes is not difficult, and like in most mobile games, you can do it right after launching the game, even without completing the tutorial. If you don't know where to find the necessary option or don't understand how to redeem codes at all, follow the detailed guidelines below:

  • Launch War Robots .
  • Go to the main menu of the game.
  • Pay attention to the upper right corner of the screen. There will be a button with a gear icon. Click on it.
  • This will open the settings menu. Here, go to the General tab and scroll to the bottom of the menu until you see the Gift Codes section.
  • This section will contain an input field and a green Get Now button next to it. Now, enter manually or, better yet, copy and paste one of the above active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click the green Get Now button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a list of rewards received on the screen. If it doesn't work, make sure you didn't make any mistakes when entering the code manually, and that you didn't insert an extra space if you copied and pasted it.

How to Get More War Robots Codes

Just as is the case with Roblox codes, you can find more codes on the game's official social media, and luckily, War Robots has plenty of them. By carefully monitoring each of them, it is highly likely that you will find fresh codes, and if not, you can try again later.

  • Official War Robots Reddit account.
  • Official War Robots Facebook page.
  • Official War Robots YouTube channel.
  • Official War Robots Instagram account.

War Robots is available on PC and mobile devices.

item.title: Brawl Stars QR Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
As befits the MOBA genre, in Brawl Stars players need to communicate with each other to win. To do this, you can use different Pins. There are many ways to get them, but the best is to use Brawl Stars QR codes.

These codes can reward you with various free goodies, including Pins and even Icons. However, after a certain time after the release, they become inactive. So you should hurry to use them.

Updated April 12, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Brawl Stars does not have regular redeem codes, but sometimes special QR codes appear for events or promotions. They only offer visual rewards, but it can be a good way to spice up your gameplay. Follow gaming news or social media to catch them when they appear.

All Brawl Stars QR Codes

Working Brawl Stars QR Codes

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Expired Brawl Stars QR Codes

There are no expired QR codes in Brawl Stars . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

Brawl Stars gives players a wide variety of different game modes. And while some of them require teamwork, others can be won solo. But in any case, you will want to customize your game profile. This can be done with the help of various Icons and Pins. The latter are used as emotes during matches. And to unlock them at the beginning of the game, you should scan Brawl Stars QR codes.

The developers release these QR codes during updates, events, or just to please the players. The codes contain various rewards, which are mainly cosmetic. But as always, their activity period is limited, so we do not recommend you delay using them.

How to Redeem Brawl Stars QR codes

Using Brawl Stars QR codes is a little different from other mobile games. However, it is still quite easy. You just need to follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch Brawl Stars and go through a short tutorial.
  • After that, scan the QR code with your phone's camera and follow the link.
  • Then tap Claim Reward.
  • This will open Brawl Stars , after which you need to tap Claim again to get your well-deserved rewards.

How to Get More Brawl Stars QR Codes

As with other mobile games, developers release free goodies quite often. But they can easily be missed by players. So, if you want to learn about Brawl Stars QR Codes first-hand, you should visit the official developers's social media pages.

  • Brawl Stars X page
  • Brawl Stars Facebook page
  • Brawl Stars YouTube channel

item.description:
Quick Links

  • Driving Empire Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Driving Empire
  • How to Play Driving Empire
  • The Best Roblox Racing Games Like Driving Empire
  • About the Driving Empire Developers

For Roblox players who cannot afford to buy themselves a new in-game car, there are Driving Empire codes that offer cash as a free reward. All of these active and expired codes can be found listed below. In addition, fans of the game will find step-by-step instructions on how to redeem Driving Empire codes here, along with a guide on how to play the popular Roblox game.

Updated April 12, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Driving Empire currently features a selection of working codes that can reward you with in-game cash and a unique vehicle. These codes offer a quick way to add to your funds or expand your garage without much effort. Theyâ€™re especially useful if you're looking to upgrade or try out new rides. New codes often arrive with milestones or seasonal events, so checking back regularly can help you stay ahead.

Codes Checked on April 12, 2025.

Driving Empire Codes

All Working Driving Empire Codes

  • OopsMyBadLol - Claim code for Cash
  • THANKS150M - Claim code for Cash
  • BURRITO - Claim code for Cash
  • COMMUNITY - Claim code for Cash

  • COMMUNITY - Claim code for Cash

How to Redeem Codes in Driving Empire

Like with many other Roblox games, Driving Empire codes are available for everyone. To redeem them, players need only follow the straightforward steps below to claim their free rewards:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Driving Empire.
  2. Look in the bottom left corner and press the Settings button here.
  3. From here, go into the Codes tab and insert the code into the text box.
  4. Once done, press Submit and claim rewards.

Codes can only be redeemed once per account. That said, players can claim the same code on multiple accounts.

How to Play Driving Empire

Playing Driving Empire is very simple and fun. To begin with, after the player has appeared in the world, they'll need to choose a car. There are many real-world cars in the game and each of them has its own characteristics, but only two cars will be available at first. To earn money, players have to drive, drift, and participate in races. For the money earned, players can buy a new car or motorbike. With the Driving Empire codes in this article, Roblox players can buy new vehicles even faster.

The Best Roblox Racing Games Like Driving Empire

There are a lot of Roblox games with the theme of racing and cars in general, and among them are plenty of good ones that offer an interesting gaming experience. In this article, players will find the best games like Driving Empire :

  • Car Dealership Tycoon
  • Drive World
  • Southwest Florida
  • Vehicle Legends
  • Ultimate Driving

About the Driving Empire Developers

Driving Empire was created by a group of developers who call themselves Voldex. Although they have released one game so far, their Roblox group already has 2 million members.
